pages.title: The Overworld Bestiary
pages.text: A compendium of land creatures and their notable traits.$(br2)Each section includes a blurb about the creature including whether it is hostile, whether it can be lured, bred or tamed and if so by what foods/items.$(br2)Most entries also include a captioned picture so that intrepid survivalists will be able to recognize them in-person.$(br)
Some creatures lend themselves to domestication$(br2)The wise Survivalist travels prepared with some cages for trapping rare or useful specimens.$(br2)Without further ado...

pages.title: Badger
pages.text: Badgers are not usually aggressive; but when threated will throw dirt as a warning.$(br2)If further provoked they will attack.$(br2)Breedable: $(l)No$()$(br2)Leadable: $(l)Unknown$()$(br2)Tameable: $(l)No$()$(br2)

pages.name: Fig.A: Badger
pages.text: Badgers will sometimes hunt or attack livestock and other domestic animals.$(br)

pages.title: Bear, Black
pages.text: These animals are usually peaceful unless provoked.$(br2)In addition to hunting prey animals they will forage for berries.$(br2)Breedable: $(l)Yes$()$(br)$(#939799)$(o)Use Salmon or Honeycomb$()$(br2)Leadable: $(l)No$()$(br2)Tameable: $(l)No$()$(br2)

pages.name: Fig.B: Black Bear
pages.text: Think twice before approaching their cubs - black bears are well known to be protective of their young.$(br2)

pages.title: Bear, Brown
pages.text: These giant creatures are peaceful unless attacked.$(br2)In addition to hunting prey animals they will forage for berries.$(br2)Breedable: $(l)Yes$()$(br)$(#939799)$(o)Use any meat$()$(br2)Leadable: $(l)No$()$(br2)Tameable: $(l)No$()$(br2)

pages.name: Fig.C: Brown Bear
pages.text: Think twice before approaching their cubs - brown bears are well known to be protective of their young.$(br2)

pages.title: Bear, Polar
pages.text: These enormous bears are peaceful unless attacked; or are protecting their young.$(br2)Polar Bears often hunt foxes that invade their territory.$(br2)Breedable: $(l)No$()$(br2)Leadable: $(l)No$()$(br2)Tameable: $(l)No$()$(br2)

pages.name: Fig.D: Polar Bear
pages.text: Do not approach when they are escorting cubs - polar bears are notoriously protective of their young.$(br2)

pages.title: Bee
pages.text: Bees prefer to live in Hives close to flowers and trees.$(br2)An active Bee colony with speed up the growth of nearby crops; as well as producing honey.$(br2)Breedable: $(l)Yes$()$(br)$(#939799)$(o)Use Flowers$()$(br2)Leadable: $(l)Yes$()$(br)$(#939799)$(o)Use Flowers, Flowering Azalea, or a Lead$()$(br2)Tameable: $(l)No$()$(br2)

pages.name: Fig.E: The Common Bee
pages.text: Bees are normally peaceful but will become aggressive if attacked; or if their Hive is disturbed. It is said that smoke can pacify them long enough to safely gather honey.$(br)

pages.title: Boar
pages.text: Boars are ornery and aggressive - attacking most anything they encounter.$(br2)Breedable: $(l)Yes$()$(br)$(#939799)$(o)Use Carrots$()$(br2)Leadable: $(l)No$()$(br2)Tameable: $(l)No$()$(br2)

pages.name: Fig.F: A Forest Boar
pages.text: Boars will forage through the undergrowth; eating any plants, vegetables or berries that they find.$(br)

pages.title: Coyote
pages.text: These opportunistic pack hunters will rest during the day; but become active and aggressive once the sun goes down.$(br2)Breedable: $(l)Yes$()$(br)$(#939799)$(o)Use meat$()$(br2)Leadable: $(l)No$()$(br2)Tameable: $(l)Yes$()$(br)$(#939799)$(o)Use Raw Chicken, Rabbit or Pheasant.$()$(br2)

pages.name: Fig.G: A Coyote
pages.text: Injured or hungry coyotes that have been tamed will lower their tail and beg for food by whimpering$(br)

pages.title: Deer
pages.text: Deer are peaceful.  They are frequently hunted for their venison; and are somewhat skittish around humans.$(br2)Breedable: $(l)Yes$()$(br)$(#939799)$(o)Use Apples, Carrots or Wheat$()$(br2)Leadable: $(l)Yes$()$(br)$(#939799)$(o)Use Breeding items$()$(br2)Tameable: $(l)No$()$(br2)

pages.name: Fig.H: Deer
pages.text: A deer can be tempted by a carrot on a stick; although they cannot be saddled.$(br)

pages.title: Dog, Shiba Inu
pages.text: An intelligent breed of dog found frequently in the mountains.$(br2)Breedable: $(l)Yes$()$(br)$(#939799)$(o)Use Meat when at full health$()$(br2)Leadable: $(l)Yes$()$(br)$(#939799)$(o)Use Bones$()$(br2)Tameable: $(l)Yes$()$(br)$(#939799)$(o)Use Bones$()$(br2)

pages.name: Fig.I: Shiba Inu
pages.text: A Shiba Inu will fetch lost arrows and tridents for its owner.  It will also bark at dark spots if their owner is holding a torch.$(br)

pages.title: Donkey
pages.text: Generally found in Plains alongside their horse bretheren.  A donkey will not wear armor; but is able to carry a chest - making it useful for long trips.$(br2)Breedable: $(l)Yes$()$(br)$(#939799)$(o)Use Golden Carrots of Apples$()$(br2)Leadable: $(l)Yes$()$(br)$(#939799)$(o)Use Leads$()$(br2)Tameable: $(l)Yes$()$(br)$(#939799)$(o)Keep riding until it is tamed$()$(br2)

pages.name: Fig.J: The Common Donkey
pages.text: A donkey can be saddled and ridden. If bred with a Horse it will produce a Mule$(br)

pages.title: Fox
pages.text: Usually found in Forests or Taiga.  Foxes like to sleep, explore and hunt birds, fish and small mammals.  They also love to eat sweet berries.$(br2)Breedable: $(l)Yes$()$(br)$(#939799)$(o)Use Sweet Berries or Glow Berries$()$(br2)Leadable: $(l)Yes$()$(br)$(#939799)$(o)Use Leads$()$(br2)Tameable: $(l)Partially$()$(br)$(#939799)$(o)Breed two adults to produce offspring that are semi-tame$()$(br2)

pages.name: Fig.K: Adult Fox
pages.text: Foxes cannot be totally tamed; but a fox that likes and trusts you will fight to protect you.$(br)

pages.title: Frog
pages.text: Usually in Marshes and Swamps.  There are rumours that careful selective breeding can produce giant frogs.$(br2)Breedable: $(l)Yes$()$(br)$(#939799)$(o)Use Spider Eyes or Fish$()$(br2)Leadable: $(l)Yes$()$(br)$(#939799)$(o)Use Leads$()$(br2)Tameable: $(l)No$()$(br2)

pages.name: Fig.L: A Frog
pages.text: Some consider frog legs a delicacy; others - a valuable potion ingredient.$(br)

pages.title: Goat
pages.text: Goats are generally peaceful; unless something gets them upset - then they may come charging in for a headbutt.  Survivalists are encouraged to be alert around goats in high places.$(br2)Breedable: $(l)Yes$()$(br)$(#939799)$(o)Use Wheat$()$(br2)Leadable: $(l)Yes$()$(br)$(#939799)$(o)Use Leads or Wheat$()$(br2)Tameable: $(l)No$()$(br2)

pages.name: Fig.M: The Common Goat
pages.text: Goats are known for producing milk; and for being excellent high jumpers$(br)

pages.title: Goose
pages.text: Geese are peaceful unless provoked.  However if you anger one it will never forget what you did.$(br2)Being quite curious Geese are known to pick up; and sometimes eat, things they find laying on the ground.$(br2)Breedable: $(l)No$()$(br)$(#939799)$(o)Break Goose Eggs to 'breed'$()$(br2)Leadable: $(l)Yes$()$(br)$(#939799)$(o)Use Leads or Seeds$()$(br2)Tameable: $(l)No$()$(br2)

pages.name: Fig.N: A Wild Goose
pages.text: Geese lay eggs regularly.  Some consider these large eggs a delicacy$(br)

pages.title: Lammergeier
pages.text: These avian predators are harmless to humans; however they love to hunt Skeletons of all kinds -- cracking the bones and feasting on their marrow$(br2)Lammergeier are found predominantly in arid, hilly regions.$(br2)Breedable: $(l)No$()$(br2)Leadable: $(l)No$()$(br2)Tameable: $(l)Yes$()$(br)$(#939799)$(o)Use Bones$()$(br2)

pages.name: Fig.O: Lammergeier
pages.text: A trained lammergeier will attack anything that threatens it's master -- except for Creepers and Ghasts$(br2)

pages.title: Moose
pages.text: Full grown Moose are very aggressive towads humans and should be approached with caution.  If left in peace they will roam their forest and graze on grasses.$(br2)Breedable: $(l)No$()$(br2)Leadable: $(l)No$()$(br2)Tameable: $(l)No$()$(br2)

pages.name: Fig.P: An Adult Moose
pages.text: Moose are; perhaps unsurprisingly, not very good swimmers

pages.title: Mule
pages.text: Produced by breeding horses with donkeys; the mule combines the best of both worlds.$(br2)They are able to be ridden and will carry a chest for you just as a Donkey would.  However they inherit some of the improved speed and jumping power of their horse parent.$(br2)Breedable: $(l)No$()$(br2)Leadable: $(l)Yes$()$(br)$(#939799)$(o)Use Leads$()$(br2)Tameable: $(l)No$()$(br2)

pages.name: Fig.Q: The Common Mule
pages.text: Mules cannot be bred; so a high quality mule can be a rare prize that is difficult to replace if lost.$(br2)

pages.title: Pheasant
pages.text: These small, mild-mannered birds are mostly encountered in grassy and forested regions.$(br2)This species of avian is domesticable similarly to Chickens$(br2)Breedable: $(l)Yes$()$(br)$(#939799)$(o)Use Pumpkins Seeds$()$(br2)Leadable: $(l)Yes$()$(br)$(#939799)$(o)Use Leads or Pumpkin Seeds$()$(br2)Tameable: $(l)No$()$(br2)

pages.name: Fig.R: A Pheasant
pages.text: Pheasants regularly lay eggs.  These eggs are prized for their delicious flavor.$(br2)

pages.title: Reindeer
pages.text: These gentle creatures are found primarily in snowy regions.  They are quite trusting and can be ridden even without a saddle.$(br2)Breedable: $(l)Yes$()$(br)$(#939799)$(o)Use Wheat or Carrots$()$(br2)Leadable: $(l)No$()$(br2)Tameable: $(l)--$()$(br)$(#939799)$(o)Already docile by nature$()$(br2)

pages.name: Fig.S: A Reindeer
pages.text: An injured Reindeer can be fed sugar, wheat, carrots or apples (golden and normal) or hay bales to heal them.$(br2)

pages.title: Songbird
pages.text: These avians come in a wide variety of species.  They are harmless and some can be quite pretty.$(br2)Breedable: $(l)Yes$()$(br)$(#939799)$(o)Use Seed.  Only same species birds can breed.$()$(br2)Leadable: $(l)No$()$(br)$(#939799)$(o)However if you are holding seeds they will not run from you$()$(br2)Tameable: $(l)No$()$(br2)

pages.name: Fig.T: The Common Songbird
pages.text: The common songbird is quite skittish and will likely run rather than allow a human to get close.$(br2)

pages.title: Squirrel
pages.text: Playful creatures; they are normally found in forested regions and love to climb trees.$(br2)They are wary of humans and will run rather than allow one to get close$(br2)Breedable: $(l)Yes$()$(br)$(#939799)$(o)Use Seed$()$(br2)Leadable: $(l)Yes$()$(br)$(#939799)$(o)Use Seed$()$(br2)Tameable: $(l)No$()$(br2)

pages.name: Fig.U: The Common Squirrel
pages.text: It is a well known fact that Squirrels are immune to fall damage.$(br2)

pages.title: Tarantula
pages.text: More aggresive than their typically boreal cousins - the Tarantula is commonly found in sandy/arid regions.$(br2)A Tarantula will attack regardless of light level and can bite or fire poisonous bristles that blind.$(br2)Breedable: $(l)No$()$(br2)Leadable: $(l)No$()$(br2)Tameable: $(l)No$()$(br2)

pages.name: Fig.V: Adult Tarantula
pages.text: Tarantulas despite Iron Golems; although the evolutionary reasons for this are unclear$(br2)

pages.title: Toretoise
pages.text: These immense and ponderous creatures can be found in cave systems.$(br2)Their tough shells make them virtually immune to normal attacks - which simply produce a damaging shockwave to anyone standing nearby when struck.$(br2)Toretoises consume glow berries and naturally grow ores of various types on their shells.$(br2)Breedable: $(l)No$()$(br2)Leadable: $(l)No$()$(br2)Tameable: $(l)No$()$(br2)

pages.name: Fig.W: Adult Toretoise
pages.text: A Toretoise can be fed Glow Berries to regrow the Ore on its back.  These ores can be harvested harmlessly with a Pickaxe$(br2)

pages.title: Turkey
pages.text: These boreal dwelling fowl are normally peaceful; but will bite back at an aggressor before returning to their normally docile state.$(br2)Like Chickens they lay eggs regularly; although they are more prized for their meat by most farmers.$(br2)Breedable: $(l)Yes$()$(br)$(#939799)$(o)Use Pumpkin Seeds$()$(br2)Leadable: $(l)Yes$()$(br)$(#939799)$(o)Use Pumpkin Seeds$()$(br2)Tameable: $(l)No$()$(br2)

pages.name: Fig.X: A Turkey
pages.text: For their size Turkeys as a livestock animal produce a significant quantity of meat and eggs.$(br2)

pages.title: Wolf, Feral
pages.text: These larger cousines of the common wolf are more dangerous and aggresive.  Commonly found in boreal regions they are very difficult to tame$(br2)A sufficiently hungry Feral Wolf will attack almost anything it thinks it can eat$(br2)Breedable: $(l)Yes$()$(br)$(#939799)$(o)Use Antlers$()$(br2)Leadable: $(l)No$()$(br2)Tameable: $(l)Yes$()$(br)$(#939799)$(o)Use Bones while wearing an Ender Dragon Head$()$(br2)

pages.name: Fig.Y: A Feral Wolf
pages.text: A tamed feral wolf that is injured will lower its tail and whine; they can be healed by feeding them most any meat.$(br2)
